memberdef.argsstring: (const ColorImage &color_frame, const Transform &T_L_C, const Camera &camera, const TsdfLayer &tsdf_layer, ColorLayer *color_layer, std::vector< Index3D > *updated_blocks=nullptr)
memberdef.name: integrateFrame

briefdescription.para: Integrates a color image into the passed color layer.

parameterdescription.para: The pose of the camera. Supplied as a Transform mapping points in the camera frame (C) to the layer frame (L).
The TSDF layer with which the color layer associated. Color integration is only performed on the voxels corresponding to the truncation band of this layer.
A pointer to the layer into which this image will be intergrated.
Optional pointer to a vector which will contain the 3D indices of blocks affected by the integration.

briefdescription.para: Returns the sphere tracer used for color integration.

detaileddescription.para: In order to perform color integration from an rgb image we have to determine which surfaces are in view. We use sphere tracing for this purpose.

briefdescription.para: Returns the object used to calculate the blocks in camera views.

detaileddescription.para: In order to perform color integration from an rgb image we have to determine which surfaces are in view. We use sphere tracing for this purpose.

briefdescription.para: A parameter getter We find a surface on which to integrate color by sphere tracing from the camera.

detaileddescription.para:
This is a relatively expensive operation. This parameter controls how many rays are traced for an image. For example, for a 100px by 100px image with a subsampling factor of 4, 25x25 rays are traced.
the ray subsampling factor

briefdescription.para: A parameter getter The truncation distance parameter associated with this integrator.

detaileddescription.para:
The truncation distance also determines the max. distance behind a surface up until which blocks are integrated.
the truncation distance in voxels

briefdescription.para: A parameter getter The maximum weight that voxels can have.

detaileddescription.para:
The integrator clips the voxel weight to this value after integration. Note that currently each integration to a voxel increases the weight by 1.0 (if not clipped).
the maximum weight

briefdescription.para: A parameter getter The maximum distance at which voxels are updated.

detaileddescription.para:
Voxels beyond this distance from the camera are not affected by integration.
the maximum intragration distance

briefdescription.para: Gets the metric truncation distance which is calculated from truncation distance in voxels and the input voxel size.

parameterdescription.para: The voxel size of the layer you want the truncation distance for.
the maximum weight of a voxel.
the maximum intragration distance in meters.

briefdescription.para: A parameter getter The type of weighting function used to fuse observations.
A parameter setter The type of weighting function used to fuse observations See weighting_function_type().

parameterdescription.para: The type of weighting function to be used

briefdescription.para: Returns the object used to calculate the blocks in camera views.
Returns the object used to calculate the blocks in camera views.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< Index3D > &block_indices, const ColorImage &color_frame, const DepthImage &depth_frame, const Transform &T_L_C, const Camera &camera, const float truncation_distance_m, ColorLayer *layer)
memberdef.name: updateBlocks

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< Index3D > &block_indices, const TsdfLayer &tsdf_layer, const float truncation_distance_m)
memberdef.name: reduceBlocksToThoseInTruncationBand

detaileddescription.para: Integrates color images into color layers. The "projective" describes one type of integration. Namely that voxels in view are projected into the depth image (the alternative being casting rays out from the camera).
